tool_description: Quickly integrate SMS messaging services into various solutions by using Infobip HTTP application programming interface (HTTP API). The HTTP API can be used for sending SMS messages, collecting delivery reports, making Number Context (number validation) requests and receiving inbound SMS messages sent from mobile phones.
name: Infobip SMS
title: Infobip SMS

api_list.name: Single textual message
api_list.description: This method allows you to send a single textual message to one or more destination addresses. http://dev.infobip.com/docs/send-single-sms
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://infobip.p.rapidapi.com/sms/1/text/single"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "infobip.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Multiple textual message
api_list.description: This method allows you to send multiple textual messages to one or more destination addresses. http://dev.infobip.com/docs/send-multiple-sms
api_list.code:

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "infobip.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Asynchronous request
api_list.description: This method gives you the ability to make a asynchronous Number Context request over HTTP. Number Context response is sent to a notify URL at your call back server. http://dev.infobip.com/docs/send-asynchronous-request
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://infobip.p.rapidapi.com/number/1/notify"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "infobip.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Synchronous request
api_list.description: his method gives you the ability to make a synchronous Number Context request over HTTP. Number Context response is returned immediately thus eliminating the need for the call back server.  http://dev.infobip.com/docs/sending-synchronous-request
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://infobip.p.rapidapi.com/number/1/query"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "infobip.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
